alert.note: Alert for Lunenburg; Mecklenburg; Prince Edward (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 05 at 11:57PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM EDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall from thunderstorms is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central Virginia and south central Virginia, including the following counties, in central Virginia, Prince Edward. In south central Virginia, Lunenburg and Mecklenburg. * WHEN...Until 300 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1155 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms with heavy rain will be crossing the area through 2 AM. Minor flooding is expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chase City, Lunenburg, Kells Corner, Rehoboth, Green Bay, Plantersville, Loves Mill, Finneywood, Blevins Corner, Fort Mitchell, Pleasant Grove, Wilburn, Fairview, Wightman, Arvins Store, North View, Rogers Corner, Gary, Oral Oaks and Spanish Grove. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
